title: Font that envokes the ocean?
content:
Is there a font I can use in a newsletter layout that envokes a sense of waves or water?  
Jbenoy

 [‹ Gently rounded font recommendation?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409022022/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42783 "Go to previous forum topic") [Running Windows XP on Mac...Freelance Graphics font Q ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409022022/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42760 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Jbenoy

comments.content:
This is probably not what you’re looking for...

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/water-flag-lt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409022022/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/water-flag-lt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/water-flag-lt/")

what aspect of water do you want to evoke - the nature/fish/ecology/aquarium part or the nautical/maritime/boating part? Or surfing, dude?

Along the same lines— [Modell Envelo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409022022/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/typefaces-401-modell-envelo), or even [Sebastian Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409022022/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/typefaces-464-sebastian-medium-pro-bold-italic), particularly if you have a “w” or two.
Thanks a bunch. I appreciate your help!!!

BTW you’ve made up a word: envoke. It’s a nice combo of evoke (to produce or suggest through artistry and imagination a vivid impression of reality: a short passage that manages to evoke the smells, colors, sounds, and shapes of that metropolis.) and invoke (to call for with earnest desire; make supplication or pray for: to invoke God’s mercy.)

I think evoke was more what you had in mind.

\>BTW you’ve made up a word: envoke

“Envoke® is a broad-spectrum herbicide that offers exceptional control of many troublesome weeds, including those often missed by glyphosate in RR cropping systems.”

Via [http://www.syngentacropprotection.com/prodrender/index.asp?nav=OVERVIEW&...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409022022/http:/www.syngentacropprotection.com/prodrender/index.asp?nav=OVERVIEW&Prodid=904 "http://www.syngentacropprotection.com/prodrender/index.asp?nav=OVERVIEW&Prodid=904")

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409022022im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/186155_6556.gif)

Frank Wildenberg of Linotype was telling me about this new typeface from Adrian Frutiger. It looks really interesting to me.

From Linotype.com:

<cite>Nami, the Japanese word for “wave,” is the latest collaboration between Adrian Frutiger and Linotype’s Type Director, Akira Kobayashi. This typeface family is the most humanistic sans serif design ever to come from Adrian Frutiger, and it has an interesting twist: lapidar alternates that may be surfed through with the help of OpenType-savy applications.</cite>

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080409022022im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Whales_4881.jpg)
  
Fontesque, or use a Photoshop filter.
yep, evokes would be it ... you’ll have to forgive ... just got out of the hospital ... appendectomy ... painkillers and such! Thanks fo all the responses.
